articles.title: Myanmar junta 'extremely disappointed' over ASEAN summit snub: Official - CNA
articles.description: YANGON: Myanmar's junta said on Saturday (Oct 16) it was "extremely disappointed" with the Association of Southeast Asian Nations' (ASEAN) decision to exclude its leader Min Aung Hlaing

articles.title: ASEAN excludes Myanmar junta leader from summit in rare move - Reuters
articles.description: Southeast Asian countries will invite a non-political representative from Myanmar to a regional summit this month, delivering an unprecedented snub to the military leader who led a coup against an elected civilian government in February.
articles.content: BANDAR SERI BEGAWAN, Oct 16 (Reuters) - Southeast Asian countries will invite a non-political representative from Myanmar to a regional summit this month, delivering an unprecedented snub to the mili… [+4053 chars]

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: ASEAN members elect not to invite Myanmar's military leader Min Aung Hlaing to summit - ABC News
articles.description: South-East Asian foreign ministers agree to downgrade Myanmar's participation in an upcoming summit in their sharpest rebuke yet of the nation's military leaders following their February 1 takeover.

articles.title: With boosters, masks and Green Pass, Israel sees a Covid-19 wave in retreat - AsiaOne
